required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Internet Based Cognitive Behavior Therapy for Procrastination: A Randomized Controlled Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Internet Based Cognitive Behavior Therapy for Procrastination: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to examine the effects of cognitive behavior therapy (CBT) for procrastination, and to investigate whether it can be delivered via the Internet. Two treatment groups will be used, one with therapist contact and one without, as well as a wait-list control group. It is assumed that the treatment group with therapist contact will be superior to the treatment group receiving no therapist contact since procrastination can be partially explained as a self-regulatory failure. Both treatment groups are presumed to be superior to the wait-list control.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Pure Procrastination Scale (PPS)
primary_outcome.description: The PPS features twelve items measuring the prevalence of procrastination.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Pure Procrastination Scale (PPS)
primary_outcome.description: The PPS features twelve items measuring the prevalence of procrastination.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Susceptibility to Temptation Scale (STS)
primary_outcome.description: The STS features eleven items measuring the susceptibility to temptation, which can affect the ability to follow through a task or commitment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Susceptibility to Temptation Scale (STS)
primary_outcome.description: The STS features eleven items measuring the susceptibility to temptation, which can affect the ability to follow through a task or commitment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Irrational Procrastination Scale (IPS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0 weeks and weekly during treatment period of 10 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The IPS features nine items measuring the degree of irrational delay causing procrastination.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Irrational Procrastination Scale (IPS)
primary_outcome.description: The IPS features nine items measuring the degree of irrational delay causing procrastination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale Self-report version (MADRS-S)
secondary_outcome.description: MADRS-S is a self-assessment version of MADRS and features nine items measuring changes in mood, anxiety, sleeping patterns, appetite, concentration, initiative, emotional engagement, pessimism and attitude towards life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale Self-report version (MADRS-S)
secondary_outcome.description: MADRS-S is a self-assessment version of MADRS and features nine items measuring changes in mood, anxiety, sleeping patterns, appetite, concentration, initiative, emotional engagement, pessimism and attitude towards life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Generalized Anxiety Disorder Assessment 7-item (GAD-7)
secondary_outcome.description: GAD-7 features seven items for assessing anxiety and screening for generalized anxiety disorder.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Generalized Anxiety Disorder Assessment 7-item (GAD-7)
secondary_outcome.description: GAD-7 features seven items for assessing anxiety and screening for generalized anxiety disorder.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Quality of Life Inventory (QOLI)
secondary_outcome.description: QOLI features 32 items concerning 16 areas of life rated by the subject concerning importance and satisfaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Quality of Life Inventory (QOLI)
secondary_outcome.description: QOLI features 32 items concerning 16 areas of life rated by the subject concerning importance and satisfaction.

intervention.intervention_name: Internet-based cognitive behavioural therapy (iCBT) without therapist contact.
intervention.description: The iCBT consists of our structured self-help program lasting a total of eight active treatment weeks and does not include a therapist contact.

intervention.intervention_name: Internet-based cognitive behavioural therapy (iCBT) with therapist contact.
intervention.description: The iCBT consists of our structured self-help program lasting a total of eight active treatment weeks and includes a therapist contact.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Primary difficulties are caused by chronic and severe procrastination
- Swedish residency
- Fluent in Swedish
- Computer with internet access
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ongoing psychotherapy
- Ongoing psychotropic medication (unless stabilized for three months)
- Severe depression (> 30 points on MADRS-S)
- Suicidal ideation
- Misuse of drugs or alcohol
- Bipolar disorder
- Schizophrenia or psychosis
